resources.string:
DNS stands for Domain Name System.

The Domain Name System is used to resolve Domains (google.com, yahoo.com, example.comâ€¦) to IP Addresses (192.168.178.1 for example) to communicate over the Internet.

It is one of the most important systems used in IP-based networks.

This App works without a rooted phone. 

To make this possible all traffic is redirected using a VPN. This VPN redirects your traffic only locally, the data never leaves your phone using this VPN connection.

You'll be asked to allow the VPN connection in the next window, without permission from you the set DNS servers won't work.


Source code can be found under https://git.frostnerd.com/PublicAndroidApps/DnsChanger.
Show a notification when DNSChanger is running
Automatically start DNSChanger when your phone is turned on
Automatically turn on DNSChanger when connecting to a wifi network
Automatically turn on DNSChanger when connecting to a mobile network

Permission to start the VPN denied. 
This could be the system denying vpn connections being started from the background for safety reasons.

Open the app to start the VPN
Would you like to rate this app?\nIt\'d help spreading it and shows appreciation of my work.
Press back again to leave (Discards changes!)

This app is set to start/stop the vpn when the type of your network changes (Either Wifi or 3G).
This might conflict with this tasker plugin as the action might be overridden by the app itself (Only one VPN can be running at any given time).

Do you want to disable these conflicting settings?

This app is set to start/stop the vpn when the type of your network changes (Either Wifi or 3G).
This might conflict with any setting when starting from a shortcut as the action might be overridden by the app itself (Only one VPN can be running at any given time).

Do you want to disable these conflicting settings?
DNSChanger was started using Tasker. Stopping it may interrupt with it. Starting it not using tasker does not apply the DNS Servers configured using Tasker. Stop anyway?
This app supports Tasker and can be used as an action plugin to automate DNS usage.
Show the currently used DNS servers in the notification
Warning: Using any of these might interfere with active Tasker profiles using this app!
Click here to change the PIN

Warning: your Android version (4.4) is known to have problems with VPN connections. If this app crashes or just doesn\'t work it\'s most likely your system and not the fault of this app.\nI\'m sorry for the inconvenience.
You choose to protect this app by PIN. Please enter the PIN you provided in the settings (default: 1234)
Ask for the PIN when stopping or pausing DNSChanger from the notification
Ask for the PIN when starting the app

The App crashed unexpectedly. This could either imply that the way this app works is not supported by your phone/ROM or a general error occurred (which most likely indicated that I did something wrong).

Either way, sending the crash report would help me a lot and could possibly lead to a fix.
Do you want to send it to me?
Ask for the PIN when starting or stopping from QuickSettings
Automatically disable when changing network (e.g Wifi to 3G). DNSChanger will activate again if set so in the previous settings.
Hey, have a look at this DNS changing app for android. You can download it here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.frostnerd.dnschanger

This app can be set as device admin to prevent removing it without entering the devices Passcode first.

No security policies are used.

This feature only works if the devices admin policy is set to request passwords when removing apps (Mostly found in businesses or shipped with parental control apps)

DNSChanger won't actually use these rights.
DNSChanger has to be removed as device admin before trying to remove it from your phone, come back to the settings to do so.
Activate this app as device admin to prevent uninstallation
Prevent uninstall by settings as device admin
Warning: When removing this app as device admin uninstalling isn\'t hindered anymore.
Enables debug which generates logfiles to be sent to the developer (Doesn\'t happen automatically)\nMay increase battery usage.

Activating the debug feature may increase the battery consumption. Additionally the generated logs contain general (non personal) information about your device [App version, Android version, Device Name, Manufacturer] and may log the DNS Servers you configure the app to use.\n\nThis data isn\'t sent automatically but keep that in mind when sending those logs to me.
Export shortcuts as well?\n\n(Exports all shortcuts created since install using this app, even those which were already deleted)
Stop DNSChanger when reclicking the shortcut it was started with
Show a notification with the reason why DNSChanger was stopped automatically
Create a shortcut bound to a specific set of DNS servers to quickly start DNSChanger
Network changed (DNSChanger is set to stop)

It looks like one of the DNS servers you configured cannot be used on your device. 
Either you entered an invalid IP address, no DNS server is present on the given ip address or it is a temporary error.

Please check the configuration in the main menu and verify that the addresses entered are correct.
Enable IPv6. This allows to provide ipv6 addresses to use as dns servers.
Any of the providers shown here might be registered trademarks of the respective owners. Their terms of use apply.\nBe aware that dns servers could log which sites you visit.
Exclude installed apps from using the VPN connection created internally. This won\'t apply the DNS servers to them
Only applications selected in the setting above will use the internal VPN. Apps not selected thus won\'t use the DNS servers set by you.
Each application selected in the setting above won\'t use the internal VPN. This won\'t apply the DNS servers to them either.
Resets all settings and saved dns servers. Shortcuts and tasker actions are not deleted.
Do you really want to reset all settings?\nThis cannot be reversed.
Sets the theme of this app
Ask for the PIN when starting or stopping from the app shortcuts
Enables app shortcuts. Long click on the apps shortcut in the launcher to open the menu
Long click on an entry to delete or edit it. Click on additional entries to delete them as well.
Enable IPv4. This allows to provide ipv4 addresses to use as dns servers
Most Android versions can\'t access the internet anymore when DNSChanger is running and no IPv4 address is provided. You\'ll have to try for your device though.

The background worker crashed with an exception present on some devices. This crash cannot be fixed by the app itself.
Either try restarting the app and if that doesn't help try restarting your device.

If the problem persists and your device is rooted try downloading the app Tun.ko Installer as it might be able to fix it. The developer of this app is DroidVPN Inc.
Link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.aed.tun.installer

This app is open source. The source code can be found at git.frostnerd.com. 
Icons from Google are used (Material icon pack - https://material.io/icons). 
 
Version [[version]] 
Build [[build]] 
 
Â© Daniel Wolf 2020 
All rights reserved. Source code licensed under GPLv3. 
https://git.frostnerd.com/PublicAndroidApps/DnsChanger 
 
Brazilian translation by Lukinhas 
 
Chinese Simplified translation by Majida Whale 
 
Vietnamese translation by Phi 
 
Norwegian bokmÃ¥l translation by Imre Kristoffer Eilertsen

Android allows you to configure DNS servers in the wifi settings - but not for mobile connections (3G, 4Gâ€¦). This however requires you to use a static IP address, doesn't allow switching easily and won't work with IPv6, among other disadvantages when compared to this app.

This app takes advantage of Androids VPN structure which allows devices to set DNS servers dynamically. To achieve this a local vpn is created which uses the same device as endpoint - this means the vpn connection neither connects to the internet itself, nor is it detectable from outside.
As this dummy-VPN can be started/stopped dynamically it allows for a range of features and automatation. This VPN isn't tapped and no data is read by it. It's just a middle man in changing the DNS servers.

If you are interested in the technical side of this, visit my git at git.frostnerd.com.

Using this app you can create shortcuts on your home screen. These shortcuts contain DNS settings and change your DNS servers by clicking them without needing you to open the app.
This makes them particular convenient if you want to quickly cycle between different servers - just create a bunch of the shortcuts and let them rest on your home screen.

You can configure the behavior of them in the settings.

For quick access you can place tiles in you notification area. They can be used to start/stop and pause/resume DNSChanger.\n\nTo add them drag down the notification area, click on the pen and drag them upwards by long-clicking them.

You can pin-protect every action which starts/stops/pauses/resumes DNSChanger. Each time one of those is to be executed a dialog shows asking for the pin set by you.

This can be used for hindering the phones user from interfering with the app if the user isn't to tech-savvy. It was developed to stop children from stopping the app.
To choose what to protect open the settings.
This cannot be disabled on Android O and above.
No easter eggs here. Go away.
All functionality has been disabled by you. Re-enable in the menu on the side to start.
Do you want to enable IPv6?
This app contains libraries created by third parties. The libraries, their creators and the licenses are listed below.
Disables the dns icon shown in the notification bar. Will still be visible when opening the notification area, might not work on newer Android versions.
This channel shows no icon in the notification bar
Go to the settings if you want to enable IPv6.
Write a small message describing why you send the log files
Allows the app to access data of DNSChanger in general
Allow authentication using any saved fingerprint
Checking whether the DNS servers are reachable

Out of [x] servers [y] are unreachable:

[servers]
The server(s) might be offline, not reachable (maybe you aren't connected to a network?) or blocked by your ISP.
Check whether the configured DNS servers are reachable each time the start button is clicked
Allow the input of custom ports in the DNS fields.
Click here to configure advanced settings.
Use the rules configured in the main menu
Show rules resolving to a loopback address

To implement the features listed below all sent DNS packets are intercepted and modified. This may increase Battery and RAM usage.\n\nUse at your own risk, no warranty is provided. By clicking OK you agree that the author of this app isn\'t liable for any damage which may result.
[x] lines were read, [y] of which were valid and [z] distinct (new) Entries.
Disable fail fast if the type cannot be detected. As this takes longer try specifying the type yourself.
Log all DNS queries when the app is running
Exports all queries in a text file to a folder of your choice
Forward the DNS queries using TCP, not UDP
Sets the time in milliseconds after which the app stops trying to reach the upstream DNS server
Allows you to input the loopback address in all fields (::1 and 127.0.0.1)
The network [name] has the following DNS servers:\n\n[servers]
Warning: [type] is missing in the configuration, but is enabled. Do you want to disable it?
The App is now importing the rules. During that time you won\'t be able to use the app as the internal database is locked for the duration.
Only show apps with the internet permission
Only allow the app to stop via the inbuilt methods
Deletes all logged queries. Cannot be reverted.
Are you sure you want to do that?
Deletes all local rules. Cannot be reverted.
Revert a rule import from a file. Cannot be reverted.
I created a new App named Nebulo, an open-source and ad-free App for dns-over-https and dns-over-tls. It is on the store.\nDo you want to have a look at it? Clicking yes opens the store.
Disable automatic reporting of crashes. Reports only contain the app version, Android version and the crash stacktrace and no personal data whatsoever.
Your device seems to be missing the capabilities to run a VPN. As this app fully relies on this feature you sadly won\'t be able to use it.
Can\'t start VPN, your users seems to be restricted.
You don\'t seem to have a browser or the store installed.
Running connectivity check. This notification will be gone soon.
This channel is used for the connectivity check as part of the automation. Feel free to disable it.
Run the automation with higher rights. Might increase stability of the automation settings.
Automatically enable DNS Changer after it has been updated.\nThis might not work when DNS Changer was not active for a prolonged time.
